definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to open fire/to shoot a gun
gunman/sharpshooter/sb who takes an exam for sb else/sb who produces a piece of work for sb else to pass off as their own
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident

sentences.english: In the latter period, they were armed with Winchester rifles, clubs and knives.
sentences.chinese: 在后阶段，她们还配备了连发枪以及军棍和军刀。

sentences.english: I like playing with a bubble gun. Can you buy one for me?
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢玩泡泡枪，可以给我买一把吗？

sentences.english: The funny cunning agent uses his gum gun before aurora or after dusk.
sentences.chinese: 幽默灵巧的赛跑者在日出之前或日落之后使用胶皮枪。

sentences.english: Lancers and dancers pass a poisoned syringe.
sentences.chinese: 枪骑兵和舞者经过一次被投毒的注射。

sentences.english: A man ran up to President Garfield, pulled out a gun, and fired twice.
sentences.chinese: 一名男子奔向加菲尔德总统，拿出一支枪射击了两次。

sentences.english: The gun usually kicks back. Watch out for it.
sentences.chinese: 枪通常有后座力，要注意。

sentences.english: Turn in your gun, or I will kill you.
sentences.chinese: 把枪交出来，否则我会杀了你。

sentences.english: Drop the gun, and no funny stuff!
You must get a permit if you want to keep a gun.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想持有一支枪，你必须弄一张许可证。

sentences.english: May I play with the bubble gun?
Use stain removal spray gun with stain removal agent to do pre-wash preparation.
sentences.chinese: 利用去渍枪，配合预处理剂完成洗前预处理。

sentences.english: An expendable jet perforating gun with large horizontal firing charges.
sentences.chinese: 带有水平点火大射孔弹的消毁式聚能射孔枪。

sentences.english: Load up on guns and, Bring your friends.
sentences.chinese: 把枪装上子弹，带上你的朋友。

sentences.english: If you dismantle me of my gun then no one will listen anymore.
sentences.chinese: 如果你拆掉了我的枪，那就没入会听我的了。

sentences.english: He shoots as well as he rides.
sentences.chinese: 他马骑得好，枪打得也好。

sentences.english: The robber held up the store cashier at gun-point for money.
sentences.chinese: 抢徒用枪威胁商店收费员，向他要钱。

definition: roof of the mouth/to load (a gun)
